ATTENDEES.Definition: people who go to a place, event, etc.

BEHOLD.Definition: to see or look at someone or something

CONCEIVABLE.Definition: possible to imagine or to believe

CONCRETE.Definition: clear and certain, or real and existing in a form that can be seen or felt

CONSERVATORY.Definition: a room with glass walls and a glass roof, usually connected to a house, used for growing plants or for relaxing in

CONTRIBUTORS.Definition: a person who contributes something, especially money, in order to provide or achieve something together with other people

EN MASSE.Definition: If a group of people do something en masse, they do it together and at the same time

ERA.Definition: a period of time of which particular events or stages of development are typical

ERECT.Definition: to build a building, wall, or other structure

EXAGGERATED.Definition: seeming larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is

GOT QUITE A TASTE.Definition: start to like or enjoy something

JEWELS.Definition: something that is very beautiful or valuable

LEGACIES.Definition: something that is left after someone or something is gone

LEGACY.Definition: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

MARVEL.Definition: to show or experience great surprise or admiration

OUTDONE.Definition: be superior to in action or performance

PAINTING A PICTURE.Definition: to describe or show something in a particular way

PRINTING PRESS.Definition: a machine that prints books, newspapers, or magazines

REMAINDER.Definition: the part of something that is left after the other parts have gone, been used, or been taken away

SHOW ITSELF OFF.Definition: to display in a way that tries to catch attention

SHOW OFF.Definition: to display in a way that tries to catch attention

SHOW THEMSELVES OFF.Definition: to display in a way that tries to catch attention

SHOWCASE.Definition: to show the best qualities or parts of something

SHOWING ITSELF OFF.Definition: to display in a way that tries to catch attention

SPECTACLE.Definition: an unusual or unexpected event or situation that attracts attention, interest, or disapproval

STATED.Definition: a condition or way of being that exists at a particular time

SWALLOWED UP.Definition: to become part of something else

SYMBOLIC.Definition: a sign, shape, or object that is used to represent something else

THE CHANNEL.Definition: the piece of water between the UK and France

THE LIKES OF WHICH.Definition: a person, thing, or group similar in character or quality to the one mentioned

WIDESPREAD.Definition: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people
